level.heading: GRANT AVAILABILITY ANNOUNCEMENTS AND APPLICATIONS (ยง 29-8202)

level.text: Except where the grant authority specifies the grantee, the availability of a grant shall be announced by one (1) of the following methods:
Publication in a newspaper of general circulation in the District of Columbia;
Publication in the District of Columbia Register; or
Any other officially established forms of notice designed to reach prospective grantees.
Each grant availability announcement shall include the following:
A brief description of the project for which funds may be available;
A statement setting forth who is eligible to apply for the grant;
The deadline for submission of applications;
The review factors to be used in selecting grant recipients;
The source of funds and estimated time the funds are available;
An address within the Agency where detailed information may be obtained and where the application may be filed; and
The time and place of a pre-application information session for prospective applicants if such a session would be useful.

level.heading: SOURCE
